file_content.text: Time is running out. You need to get to the Artus system. Stop the Eradicators.
There is... one more thing. Darth Zhorrid heard you were returning to Dromund Kaas. She wants to speak to you.
Any idea what she wants?
Oh?
No. She tells me very little.
I'm sorry about before... when she tortured you.
It's my fault she hurt you.
You aren't to blame. Zhorrid is... unpredictable.
She's insane. You know that, right?
Zhorrid is a danger.
Yes. I know.
I've done my best to shield Intelligence from our new lord. You've been the unfortunate exception.
Do what it takes to survive Zhorrid's attentions a little longer. Beyond that... the Dark Council won't let this continue forever.
What's that supposed to mean?
I don't follow you.
It means that even the Dark Council will police its members if the damage is great enough.
Yes, sir.
We can't wait for the Dark Council. Someone needs to act.
We should stop her.
Enough. Some things are too dangerous to think, let alone say. Even in private.
We're getting pretty close, Zhorrid and me.
I like that woman.
I'm sure you are.
When you're through, head to the Artus system.
This is our only chance, Cipher. Fail, and we all pay a grievous cost.
Cipher Nine. Come inside.
This should be a triumphant moment. It's a tremendous achievement, bringing down the Eagle.
But the crisis has only escalated. The Eradicators could begin firing at any moment.
I understand, sir.
Acknowledged.
What's our current status?
Updates?
The Eagle's dead. He was my assignment.
I did my job.
Your assignment is whatever I choose.
Watcher Two? Your report.
The Moffs have placed local forces on alert, and a search for the Eradicators is underway.
Unfortunately, trends suggest we can only find one device every five hours; it'll be weeks before we destroy them all.
Disappointing, but not a surprise. Damage projections?
Estimates are ten to fifty million deaths on each planet targeted. Forty percent military, sixty percent civilian.
Even at the low end, that's unacceptable.
We can't allow it.
Agreed. It sends the message that the Empire is vulnerable.
So what do we do?
Not bad odds for survival, all things considered.
Could be worse.
Better than the odds of a Cipher reaching retirement age.
Enough. Snipe at each other on your own time.
Sorry, sir.
In order to deactivate the Eradicators en masse, we need the control codes.
Half the codes were on the Eagle's computers. We can only surmise that the other half are with the Eagle's patron.
Yes. The "patron." A man whom the Eagle claims is inside the Empire.
You sound skeptical.
"Claims"?
Any idea who it could be?
We need to find him.
Doesn't sound very plausible.
I don't believe it.
I have my doubts that this patron is really a highly placed Imperial. It seems unlikely such a person could escape our scrutiny.
Nonetheless, we can't ignore the possibility of a traitor. That's why we're meeting privately; only the people in this room know the full situation.
Caution would seem prudent.
Let's keep it that way.
Indeed. Watcher Two?
How do you know everyone here is trustworthy?
One of us could be a traitor.
I hope you're joking. Otherwise, I expect you to back up any allegations.
You sent Watcher Three to Hutta. He knows, too.
Us, and Watcher Three.
An oversight. Watcher Three has been instructed not to speak to anyone.
Finish the report, Watcher Two.
The Eagle had been sending periodic transmissions to someone in the Artus system.
Artus is uninhabited, devoid of resources and off the major hyperlanes. Our patron could certainly hide there.
I want you to lead a mission to Artus. You're to find the Eagle's patron and obtain his half of the control codes.
Watcher Two will rendezvous with you there. She knows more about the Eradicators than anyone.
I'll be glad to have her around. We'll get the job done.
Yes, sir.
Are you alright with this?
Your thoughts, Watcher?
I'll do what's necessary.
I'd rather do this alone, sir.
Is this necessary?
It's not up for debate. I want her with you.
I won't be in your way; I'll monitor the mission, same as always.
Your ships will be outfitted with cloaking devices; they'll only last one jump, but they'll get you into Artus unnoticed.
After that, infiltrate whatever base the patron is using. Recover the Eradicator control codes and stop the threat.
Watcher Two--you're dismissed.
If you want to talk before the mission, I'll be at my station.
This is Keeper, recording a message for Cipher Nine. I understand you're running an errand for Darth Zhorrid.
She has asked me to relay instructions. You are to meet her in her new chambers on Dromund Kaas--the ones formerly occupied by her father.
I hope the mission's gone well. Keeper out.
He sound a little strange to you, too? Not that it matters...
This is Keeper to Cipher Nine. I understand you're running an errand for Darth Zhorrid.
It's not my place to know a Dark Council member's business, so I won't ask what she wants. I only want to advise you to take care.
I've met her twice, now, but I don't know much about her.
Tell me about Zhorrid.
I can't tell you much. But she's not beloved by the other Dark Lords--there was resistance to giving her her father's council seat.
That's unusually thoughtful of you, Keeper.
Is everything alright?
These are unusual circumstances. Would that they were different.
I hope you're not speaking ill of our new lord.
That sounds like disapproval.
Certainly not, and I'll thank you not to suggest it.
Zhorrid has relocated to Darth Jadus's old chambers on Dromund Kaas. She awaits you there; Keeper out.
You have an assignment, and I have work to do.
This is Keeper. Suspend all nonessential activities, Cipher Nine; you are to respond to this message immediately.
I'm here, sir. What's going on?
Acknowledged.
I'm sort of in the middle of things, Keeper.
Now's not a good time.
Then disentangle yourself. This won't wait.
You'll have to define "nonessential" first.
"Nonessential activities"?
Unless you're fighting for your life, I need your full attention.
Since Darth Jadus's assassination, other Sith have been competing for his seat on the Dark Council. His successor has just been confirmed.
His daughter--Darth Zhorrid--has come to Dromund Kaas to take her father's position. She wants to meet with you.
Why me? I barely knew Jadus.
Me?
In truth, I'm not sure.
How much do we know? Background, personality--the works.
What's she like?
You're serious? Darth Jadus has a daughter?
His what?
It took me by surprise as well.
Zhorrid is Jadus's only known apprentice, which should've guaranteed her his seat. I understand there were... complications.
Meet her in the Citadel, and treat her with the respect due one who speaks for the Emperor. But be cautious. Keeper out.
